intro: Psychotria caloneura, commonly known as the velvetleaf psychotria, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Psychotria caloneura is also known for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though its medicinal properties remain under study.
